intro: Rosa mosquensis, commonly known as the mosquito rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is characterized by its fragrant, pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in marshy or swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated edge. Rosa mosquensis is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
